summary: This bill, HR 3794, is for the relief of Juana Maria Flores. It grants her eligibility for an immigrant visa or adjustment of status to become a lawful permanent resident, waiving certain grounds for removal or denial of admission. It also addresses the rescission of any outstanding removal orders against her. The application must be filed within two years of the bill's enactment. Upon approval, the Secretary of State will reduce the available immigrant visas for her country of birth. The bill also specifies that her family members will not receive preferential immigration treatment.
